com.samskivert.jdbc
Class AutoCloseOperation<V>

java.lang.Object
  com.samskivert.jdbc.AutoCloseOperation<V>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Repository.Operation<V>
public abstract class AutoCloseOperation<V>
extends Object
implements Repository.Operation<V>

An Repository.Operation wrapper that automatically closes all statements opened by the operation.

Author:
Charlie Groves

Constructor Summary

abstract  V cleanInvoke(Connection conn, DatabaseLiaison liason)
          See Repository.Operation.invoke(java.sql.Connection, com.samskivert.jdbc.DatabaseLiaison).
 V invoke(Connection conn, DatabaseLiaison liaison)
          Invokes cleanInvoke(java.sql.Connection, com.samskivert.jdbc.DatabaseLiaison) and then closes any statements opened by that call.

Constructor Detail

AutoCloseOperation

public AutoCloseOperation()
Method Detail

cleanInvoke

public abstract V cleanInvoke(Connection conn,
                              DatabaseLiaison liason)
                       throws SQLException,
                              PersistenceException
See Repository.Operation.invoke(java.sql.Connection, com.samskivert.jdbc.DatabaseLiaison). Any Statement or PreparedStatement objects created during the invocation of this method will automatically be closed.

Throws:
SQLException
PersistenceException

invoke

public final V invoke(Connection conn,
                      DatabaseLiaison liaison)
               throws SQLException,
                      PersistenceException
Invokes cleanInvoke(java.sql.Connection, com.samskivert.jdbc.DatabaseLiaison) and then closes any statements opened by that call.

Specified by:
invoke in interface Repository.Operation<V>
Parameters:
conn - the database connection on which the operations will be performed.
liaison - a database liaison for the supplied connection which can be used to determine things for which there is no standard way to determine via JDBC.
Throws:
SQLException - if thrown, this will be wrapped in a PersistenceException before being passed up to the operation invoker.
PersistenceException - can be thrown if something goes awry when executing the operation. Note that the operation will not be retried if a persistence exception is thrown. Such exceptions are assumed to be application specific and not indicative of a basic JDBC failure. The transaction will be rolled back in such cases, however.
